## Objective
Implement core tokenizer and parser for CRYSTAL23 .d12 files.

- KEYWORD: Structure types, SCF keywords, optimization keywords

- IDENTIFIER: Element symbols, labels

\`\`\`
Title line (comment)
CRYSTAL | SLAB | POLYMER | MOLECULE | HELIX | EXTERNAL
[Space/Layer group specification]
[Lattice parameters]
[Atomic positions]
END (optional)
[Basis set section]
END (optional)
[Hamiltonian section]
END
[Properties section] (optional)
END

\`\`\`typescript
interface CrystalDocument {
  title: string;
  structureType: 'CRYSTAL' | 'SLAB' | 'POLYMER' | 'MOLECULE' | 'HELIX' | 'EXTERNAL';
  geometry: GeometrySection;
  basisSet: BasisSetSection;
  hamiltonian: HamiltonianSection;
  properties?: PropertiesSection;
  endKeywords: Position[];
}
\`\`\`

- Context-dependent parsing (number of atoms affects position line count)
- Optional END keywords between sections
- EXTERNAL keyword changes expected format
- Inline vs referenced basis sets

- Parse complex multi-section input
- Handle malformed inputs gracefully
- Benchmark 1000+ atom structures

description:
## Objective
Implement the core async LSP client for Python/Textual.

## Architecture
\`\`\`python
class LSPClient:
    """Async LSP client using subprocess communication."""
    
    def __init__(self, server_cmd: list[str]):
        self._process: asyncio.subprocess.Process
        self._request_id: int = 0
        self._pending: dict[int, asyncio.Future] = {}
        self._handlers: dict[str, Callable] = {}
    
    async def start(self) -> None:
        """Spawn server process and initialize."""
        
    async def request(self, method: str, params: dict) -> Any:
        """Send request and await response."""
        
    async def notify(self, method: str, params: dict) -> None:
        """Send notification (no response expected)."""
        
    def on_notification(self, method: str, handler: Callable) -> None:
        """Register notification handler."""
        
    async def shutdown(self) -> None:
        """Graceful shutdown sequence."""
\`\`\`
